about_the_game:
You have been sent out to the frontier of human-charted space in a small mining ship, tasked with expanding humanity's footprint amongst the stars. In order to succeed, you will need to collect resources, automate production, expand your base of operations, and research new technologies.

Build a Factory

There's too much work to do yourself. Build machines, connect them with conveyor belts, and plan out your production lines in order to make sure everything is running at maximum efficiency.

Expand Your Base

Space stations are the center of your logistic network. Decide whether to build a massive base of operations, or distribute your production between multiple stations and manage transporting items between them.

Command a Fleet

Ships form the backbone of your transportation network and your defences. Give your fleet a schedule of orders, or take command from your flagship in order to maximize their success when it counts.

Defend Your Base

Your industrial activity has awakened an ancient alien defence system. Use your fleet of ships to protect your base, taking advantage of their mobility to respond to threats. Or, take the fight to the enemy and destroy their defence platforms and shipyards.

Research New Technology

Use the items you produce to research new technology. Prioritize the research that matters most to your survival and unlock new ships, station modules, items, and buffs to help you expand your base.

name: Main Sequence

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-8400 or equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GTX 1050 or AMD RX 460
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Main Sequence is a factory automation game where your goal is to build an interstellar industrial empire. Collect resources, automate production, and expand your fleet of ships in order to survive the threat that awaits.
